intro: Cuphea mexiae, commonly known as Mexican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular red or orange flowers. The plant produces distinctive, hairy, glandular leaves that are often arranged in opposite pairs. Cuphea mexiae is typically grown as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and ability to thrive in full sun. It prefers well-drained soil and is often used in gardens for its aesthetic value.
